item.description:
Now in its 26th year, Boston By Foot celebrated Halloween extravaganza highlights the Hill’s rich heritage of mystery and suspense, against a backdrop of one of Boston's most festive Halloween neighborhoods. Sites include the home of the murdered George Parkman, the lane favored by the “sleepwalking” murderer, the Common where capital offenders were hanged, and many more spooky stories of danger and intrigue. Costumes optional but encouraged!

Tour will proceed rain or shine; no reservations necessary. Admission: $20 for general public.

(And don't miss our "Grave Undertakings" tour of Boston's historic graveyards on Saturday, October 22!)
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet at the steps of the Massachusetts State House, on the corner of Park and Beacon Streets. You can't miss us!
item.name: Beacon Hill with a BOO!
